title: 108_s1582
content: The Act titled "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments regarding the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests, specifying the process, administration, and funding for such acquisitions. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 outlines the acquisition process for outstanding mineral interests, including the use of available funds and the declaration of taking if negotiations fail. Any shortfall in compensation will be covered by a permanent judgment appropriation. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows for the Secretary to determine just compensation for acquisitions, with payment from a permanent judgment appropriation. The Trust is responsible for determining obligations and expenditures, and solicitation of donations is also addressed. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 addresses the obligations and expenditures of the Trust, including the manner in which they shall be incurred, allowed, and paid. It also amends the solicitation of donations and the use of proceeds from claims, judgments, or settlements arising from activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. It also amends the solicitation of donations and the use of proceeds from claims, judgments, or settlements arising from activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act (U.S.C. 698v-5(e)) is amended to specify the selection and compensation of the chair of the Board of Trustees. The chair may be compensated at a rate determined by the Board, not exceeding the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States Code. The chair of the Board of Trustees may be compensated at a rate not exceeding the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States Code, with a maximum limit of 25 percent of that annual rate. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Property Disposal Limitations amended under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act to include exclusions for the disposal of real property. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include exclusions for the disposal of real property, specifically excluding the sale or disposal of forage, forest products, or marketable renewable resources. Additionally, amendments are made to the law enforcement and fire management sections of the Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to exclude the sale or disposal of certain real property items. Changes are also made to the law enforcement and fire management sections, including collaboration between the Secretary and the Trust for fire preparedness and suppression services on the Preserve. The Secretary, in consultation with the Trust, will develop a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve. The plan must align with the management program and be carried out through a cooperative agreement. The Secretary will provide fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency services through a cooperative agreement with the Trust. Reimbursable services may also be provided on a reimbursable basis. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
